New Records: The Dodgers made history by hitting three leadoff home runs in a game for the first time in their 141-year history.
Key Match Events: The Dodgers survived a game where they had only three available relievers and blew leads on three occasions to take their largest lead in the division in more than a month.
Shohei Ohtani hit his 44th home run of the season to straightaway center field, continuing his pursuit of the first 50 homer-50 steal season in MLB history.
Mookie Betts hit a home run in the first inning, his 14th of the year and fourth since returning from a broken hand earlier this month.
Freddie Freeman completed the historic trifecta with a line drive to right, the first time in Dodgers' history the team went deep in their first three at-bats of a game.
The Diamondbacks scored four times in the bottom of the first, benefiting from poor Dodgers defense on Corbin Carroll's inside-the-park home run and Lourdes Gurriel Jr.'s two-run double.

The Dodgers finally went in front for good in the ninth after singles from Will Smith and Gavin Lux, and a sacrifice bunt from Kiké Hernández, key trade deadline acquisition Tommy Edman feathered a single into right to drive in two go-ahead runs.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Dave Roberts emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance after Clayton Kershaw's toe injury forced an already overworked bullpen to throw eight innings in a dramatic 10-9 win the night before.
The Dodgers were hoping to get length out of rookie starter Gavin Stone, but after five stressful innings and 84 pitches, Roberts deemed 'he was tapped out' at the start of the sixth.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Dave Roberts reflected on the Dodgers' current situation in the standings, where their once nine-game lead was whittled to as little as two games a couple weeks ago.
Evan Phillips reflected on the Dodgers' current situation in the standings, where their once nine-game lead was whittled to as little as two games a couple weeks ago.
Roberts echoed that the intensity the Dodgers have tapped into the past two nights needs to remain for the rest of the season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in a high-wind environment, which brought the potential for 'explosive fire growth' across L.A. County this week.
The Dodgers' Big 3 hitters one-upped each other in a feat never before completed in the club's 141-year history.
The Dodgers' current situation in the standings has brought out the best in them, according to Roberts.
